title: This Was the Most Expensive American Plane in World War II – 24

title: When Corporate Misconduct Leads to Death, Deferred Prosecution Should Not Be Permitted
description: Department of Justice (DOJ) prosecutors are empowered to resolve serious corporate criminal allegations through deferred prosecution agreements (DPA). In a new paper, I argue that DPAs should not be permitted when corporate misconduct causes people to lose their lives.
keywords: white collar crime, boeing 737 max, deferred prosecution agreement, doj, dpa, false claims act, fcpa, general motors, gm, justice department, southern district of new york, speedy trial act
